biography.value: Resembling some sort of canine or feline quadruped at a distance, the absorber’s monstrous nature becomes quickly apparent as it closes in. Named for its ability to draw magical energy into its body, the absorber can release that energy in devastating blasts through its tail, whose eye is constantly on the lookout for prey.

description.value:
The absorber makes three attacks: one with its bite or Mind Bolt and two with its claws.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: [[/damage 1d10 + @mod type=piercing average=true]] damage plus [[/damage 1d10 type=force average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 1d6 + @mod type=slashing average=true]] damage plus [[/damage 1d6 type=force average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Ranged Spell Attack: +8 to hit, range 120 ft., one creature. Hit: [[/damage 4d10 type=psychic average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] casts [[lookup @item.name]].

Magic Resistance. The absorber has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Pounce. If the absorber moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits its claws attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a [[/save str 17 format=long]] or be knocked &Reference[prone]{prone}. If the target is &Reference[prone]{prone}, the absorber can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

When the absorber takes damage from a spell, the absorber takes only half the triggering damage. If the spellcaster is within 60 feet of the absorber, the absorber can &Reference[force]{force} the caster to make a [[/save dex 16 format=long]]. Unless the save succeeds, the caster takes the other half of the damage.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.
